{"comments": {"id": 28400, "count": 173, "talk_id": 29391}, "threadId": 28400, "requested_language_english_name": "English", "current_talk": "29391", "description": "Want to learn a new language but feel daunted or unsure where to begin? You don't need some special talent or a \"language gene,\" says L\u00fddia Machov\u00e1. In an upbeat, inspiring talk, she reveals the secrets of polyglots (people who speak multiple languages) and shares four principles to help unlock your own hidden language talent -- and have fun while doing it.", "event": "TED Salon Brightline Initiative", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "L\u00fddia Machov\u00e1: The secrets of learning a new language", "slug": "lydia_machova_the_secrets_of_learning_a_new_language", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "4899", "slug": "lydia_machova", "is_published": true, "firstname": "L\u00fddia", "lastname": "Machov\u00e1", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Language mentor", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/80d929f3e6c56ca4e772d1aeff2159cfb745cf00_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "L\u00fddia Machov\u00e1 teaches people how they can learn any language by themselves.", "whylisten": "

Lýdia Machová has learned nine languages without ever living abroad or in a multilingual environment. She maintains seven of them at a fluent level, and she usually learns a new one every two years. After meeting dozens of polyglots, or people who speak a lot of languages, she now shares the principles of language learning with the world as a language mentor.

Machová was the main organizer of the world's biggest polyglot event, the Polyglot Gathering in Bratislava, Slovakia, in 2017 and 2018. She holds a PhD in translation studies and previously worked as a professional conference interpreter. She is based in Slovakia but travels often on her mission to help people learn languages in their own ideal way.

Lýdia Machová has learned nine languages without ever living abroad or in a multilingual environment. She maintains seven of them at a fluent level, and she usually learns a new one every two years. After meeting dozens of polyglots, or people who speak a lot of languages, she now shares the principles of language learning with the world as a language mentor.

Machová was the main organizer of the world's biggest polyglot event, the Polyglot Gathering in Bratislava, Slovakia, in 2017 and 2018. She holds a PhD in translation studies and previously worked as a professional conference interpreter. She is based in Slovakia but travels often on her mission to help people learn languages in their own ideal way.

"}], "speaker_name": "L\u00fddia Machov\u00e1", "tags": ["language", "education", "communication", "culture", "personal growth", "speech"], "title": "The secrets of learning a new language", "video_type": {"id": "7", "name": "TED Salon Talk (partner)"}, "viewed_count": 4230228}]}
author: Lýdia_Machová;
title: The secrets of learning a new language
